lamblin.tweetstats

Class Arguments

  • java.lang.Object
    • lamblin.tweetstats.Arguments

  • public class Arguments
extends java.lang.Object
    Arguments to parse for TweetStatsCmd.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean help
      The help flag is either "-h" or "--help".
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> inputs
      The input flag is either "-i" or "--input" followed by an input file or directory path.
      java.lang.String output
      The output flag is either "-o" or "--output" followed by a directory path on.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> remainingInputs
      Any remaining arguments not being a flag nor paired with one are gathered and processed as the input flag would be, except after each of the input flags if any.
      boolean unconstrained
      The "--unconstrained" flag, or "-u" for short is used to change the running median implementation from the limited RangeRunningMedian to the less limited QueueRunningMedian.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Arguments() 

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • help

        public boolean help
        The help flag is either "-h" or "--help".

      • inputs

        public final java.util.List<java.lang.String> inputs
        The input flag is either "-i" or "--input" followed by an input file or directory path. This may be specified multiple times and each instance is processed before arguments without a flag.

      • output

        public java.lang.String output
        The output flag is either "-o" or "--output" followed by a directory path on. This may be specified once. The files "ft1.txt" and "ft2.txt" are [over] written in this directory.

      • unconstrained

        public boolean unconstrained
        The "--unconstrained" flag, or "-u" for short is used to change the running median implementation from the limited RangeRunningMedian to the less limited QueueRunningMedian.

      • remainingInputs

        public final java.util.List<java.lang.String> remainingInputs
        Any remaining arguments not being a flag nor paired with one are gathered and processed as the input flag would be, except after each of the input flags if any. If both input flags and these remaining arguments are not specified, input is read from stdin.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Arguments

        public Arguments()
